title: Recipes
text:
Preface
These are the recipes I like to use.
Key:
 Vegan
 Freezable
 Family recipe

title: Tips and Tricks
text: Conversions

title: Tips and Tricks
text:
Ingredient
Substitution
Notes




100g SR flour
little less than 100g P flour + 1tsp BP
Mix well


1 egg
1/4 cup or 2.5oz apple sauce
Works in fruity, heavy cakes like carrot cake.


1 egg white
50ml aquafaba
Whips to stiff peaks. Used in mini rolls.

title: Tips and Tricks
text:
Brownie method
Makes thick gloopy batter and nice gooey brownies.

Melt chocolate and butter slowly.
Stir in sugar and set aside.
Beat eggs in small jug with fork.
Well method to combine everything, just before going in the oven.

title: Tips and Tricks
text:
Aquafaba

Whip on speed 4.
4-5 mins for light and fluffy.
8 mins for stiff peaks?

title: Tips and Tricks
text:
Other notes

When using apple cider vinegar and BP in vegan cakes, once mixed get in oven quickly.
Chocolate chips work better than cut up chocolate in cookies (because the way they melt?).

title: Biscuits
text:
Almond cookies
Method
Notes

title: Biscuits
text:
60ml aquafaba
225g ground almonds
160g caster sugar
almond extract
flaked almonds


180°
13-15mins
24 cookies




Mix sugar and ground almonds.
Whisk aquafaba with fork until light, frothy and foamy, about 2 mins.
Mix all together.
Roll, then press slightly in flaked almonds, both sides
Bake.



Nice, but make them small since sweet and dry.

title: Biscuits
text:
Bourbons 


200g butter
100g caster sugar
2tbsp cocoa
280g P flour

Filling:
75g butter
100g icing sugar
2tbsp custard powder
2tbsp cocoa powder
30g melted dark chocolate

160°
15-20mins
30 small sandwiches


Method

Cream sugar and butter.
Stir in dry and mix to dough.
Chill 30mins.
Roll to 0.5cm thick, cut, prick, bake.
For filling, cream sugar and butter first.

Notes

“Like a bourbon, but good!”;
Freezing changes the texture - do not recommend.

title: Biscuits
text:
Chocolate chip cookies  


125g (4.5 oz) marg
100g (3.5oz) light brown sugar
2tbsp syrup
vanilla
160g (5.5oz) SR flour
150g chocolate chips

180°
12mins
21 x 29g balls


Method

Combine, roll, chill, bake.

Notes

Chopped chocolate changes texture of cookie, so try to use chips.
15 x 39g balls for bake sale size.

title: Biscuits
text:
Chocolate crackle tops 


7oz plain chocolate
3.5oz butter
4oz caster sugar
3 eggs
vanilla
7.5oz P flour
1oz cocoa
1/2tsp BP
pinch salt

160°
10-15mins
22 cookies


Method

Melt chocolate and butter.
Mix, chill for 1 hr, roll in icing sugar, bake.

title: Biscuits
text:
Chocolate fork biscuits 


150g P flour
1tsp BP
70g caster sugar
125g marg
1tsp vanilla
20g cocoa
pinch salt

180°
15mins


Method

Cream sugar, marg, vanilla.
Roll, fork, bake.

title: Biscuits
text:
Chocolate orange cookies 


125g butter
125g light brown sugar
75g caster sugar
50ml milk
1 orange zest
215g P flour
35g cocoa
1/2 tsp BP
1/4tsp B of S
1/4tsp salt
250g chocolate chips

180°
12-14mins


Method

Cream, add wet, then dry, roll and bake.
Leave to cool 10 mins on tray before moving.

Notes

Soft.

title: Biscuits
text:
Coconut cookies  


112g butter
200g caster sugar
1/2 tsp vanilla
156g P flour
1/2 tsp B of S
1/4tsp salt
106g coconut
4tbsp milk

180°
12mins
20 cookies


Method

As they bake, they spread a lot.; Bake until edges firm and set, middle will still be soft but will firm when cooling.

Notes

Chewy and coconutty.

title: Biscuits
text:
Coconut oat cookies 


100g brown sugar
115g margarine
3tbsp syrup
1tsp vanilla
145g oats
125g P flour
180g coconut
1tsp B of S
1/2 tsp cinnamon
1tbsp- milk

180°
15-18mins
22 cookies


Method

Melt sugar, marg, syrup.
Roll, bake.

title: Biscuits
text:
Double chocolate cookies  


110g margarine
100g caster sugar
100g light brown sugar
1tsp vanilla
125g P flour
55g cocoa
1tsp BP
pinch salt
1tbsp milk
100g chocolate chips

180°
10mins
20 cookies


Method

Roll, chill, slightly flatten, bake.
Optional to top with chips.

Notes

Chewy, soft.
Nice with 50-50 hazelnuts;chocolate chips.
15-16 x 40g balls for bake sale size.

title: Biscuits
text:
Double chocolate cookies 


125g butter
175g light brown sugar
1 egg
175g SR flour
50g cocoa
100g chocolate chips

170°
12-15mins
25 cookies


Method

Cream until light and fluffy.
Beat in eggs.
Fold rest.
Roll, chill, bake.

Notes

Chewy and crisp.
Nice with hazelnuts too.

title: Biscuits
text:
Gingerbread  


125g (4.5oz) marg
100g (3.5oz) dark brown sugar
4tbsp syrup
325g (11.5oz) P flour
1tsp B of S
2tsp ginger
1tsp cinnamon

170°
9-10mins
17 trees


Method

Melt marg, sugar, syrup.
Stir to a stiff dough.
Roll, cut, chill, bake.

Notes

Can bake dough from frozen, add couple more minutes.

title: Biscuits
text:
Hobnobs 


75g butter
75g caster sugar
1/2tbsp syrup
75g wholemeal flour
150g oats
1/2 tsp B of S

180°
10mins
15 cookies


Method

Beat butter and sugar.
Mix in syrup.
Add mixed dry to wet a bit at a time -> crumbly mix.
Press mixture into a 6.5cm cookie cutter and compress
Bake and top.

Notes

A bit too sweet, so needs that dark chocolate - could try reducing sugar?
Used ~60g chocolate to cover.
2tbsp mix per biscuit.
Like crumble mix.

title: Biscuits
text:
Lebkuchen  


7oz runny honey
3oz butter
7oz P flour
3.5oz ground almonds
1tsp BP
1/4tsp B of S
1.5tsp cinnamon
1.5tsp ginger
1tsp mixed spice
(0.5tsp nutmeg/allspice/..)
half zest and juice of orange
200g chocolate

180°
15mins
18 cookies


Method

Melt honey and butter, then cool 5 mins in fridge.
Add remaining then chill for at least an hour.
Roll with damp hands.
Bake, cool, dip.

Notes

“Like a jaffa cake”.
Used 108g chocolate to coat bottoms

title: Biscuits
text:
Lemon sandwich biscuits 


150g butter
1 lemon zest
85g caster sugar
1 egg yolk (optional)
280g P flour
1tbsp cornflour

Filling:
75g butter
130g icing sugar
2tbsp lemon curd.

180°
14-16mins
20 sandwiches


Method

Cream sugar, butter, zest 2-3 mins until pale and creamy.
Beat in egg yolk 1 min.; Mix in flour -> clumps.
Bring to ball, roll to 3-4mm thick, chill at least an hour.
Cut, bake.
Beat buttercream 3-5mins until very pale and creamy before adding lemon curd.

Notes

Can top with simple lemon icing.

title: Biscuits
text:
Nankhatai 


3 green cardamom pods
40g icing sugar
100g butter
70g SR flour
25g semolina
25g gram flour
pinch salt
almonds

140°
20mins
24 cookies


Method

Grind cardamom seeds with 1tsp icing sugar.
Beat butter, sugar, cardamom until light and creamy about 10mins.
Marble-sized balls.
Flatten slightly with almond.
Chill 20 mins before baking.

Notes

Delicate flavour and light biscuit.

title: Biscuits
text:
Oaty chocolate chip cookies  


4oz marg
4oz light brown sugar
1 egg
1tsp vanilla
5oz SR flour
3oz oats
8oz choc chips

190°
15-20mins
19 cookies

title: Biscuits
text:
Shortbread   


8oz butter
8oz (icing sugar + cornflour)
8oz plain flour
demerara sugar

170°
15mins
37 5.5cm cookies

title: Biscuits
text:
Triple chocolate cookies


200g butter
300g light brown sugar
vanilla
2 eggs
80g cocoa
300g SR flour
1tsp BP
300g chocolate chips

180°
14mins
28 cookies

title: Biscuits
text:
Viennese biscuits  


250g butter
50g icing sugar
225g P flour
25g cornflour
Filling:
100g butter
200g icing sugar

170°
10-15mins
30 small whirls
18 small fingers



Method

Lots beating to pale and fluffy.
Then sieve flours and beat until well mixed.
Pipe and bake.

Notes

To make jam use 160g raspberries and 200g jam sugar.
100g dark chocolate to dip.

title: Bread
text: Basic Bread

title: Bread
text:
500g bread flour
1/2tsp salt
1tsp yeast
1tsp sugar
1tbsp oil
325ml warm water

220°
35mins
Loaf

title: Bread
text:
Focaccia  


500g bread flour
7g yeast
2 + 1.5 + 1 tbsp olive oil
salt
rosemary
350-400ml water

200°
25mins
25 x 35”


Method

Knead 5-10mins.
Prove 1hr.
Stretch to fit tin.
Prove 45m.
Dimple, add rosemary, drizzle with oil, 1tbsp water, salt.
Bake.
Drizzle with oil while hot.

Notes

Half mix fits nicely in 20cm square.

title: Bread
text:
Fruit and nut rolls  


150g wholemeal bread flour
150g P flour
1tsp salt
1tsp yeast
1tsp brown sugar
1tsp oil
110g nuts
100g fruit

200°
15-20mins
8


Method

Combine flour, salt and yeast. . Mix 200ml hot water with sugar and oil.
Form dough and knead 5 mins.
Press into 30cm square, scatter fruit and nuts, roll, cut, shape.
Prove 1h 15m then bake.

title: Bread
text:
Garlic doughballs  


50g butter
300g white bread flour
7g yeast
1tbsp sugar
1tsp salt
Topping:
100g butter
1 garlic clove

160°
25-30mins
30


Method

Add butter to 175ml warm water first.
Knead 5mins until bouncy and smooth.
Prove 1.5-2 hours.
Knock back and knead for several minutes.
Roll into balls about 0.5cm apart.
Prove 30mins.
Bake then brush some of the butter and leave cool for 5 mins.

title: Bread
text:
Pizza dough  


1/2tsp yeast
150ml warm water
1/4tsp sugar
220g P flour
3/2tbsp extra virgin olive oil
1/3tsp salt
semolina




Method

Bloom yeast, water and sugar for 10mins -> bubble.
Combine until shaggy dough.
Knead 10-15min.
Prove.
Semolina under dough on baking tray.

title: Bread
text:
Rolls  


500g bread flour
340ml water
4g yeast
8g salt
6g sugar

200°
16-18mins
10 rolls


Method

Bloom yeast.
Gradually add dry.
Knead 10mins.
Turn and prove 1hr.
Turn and prove 30mins.
Roll balls and rest 5 mins.
Shape into ovals.
Prove 20mins.
Bake.

Notes

Add steam to oven.

title: Bread
text:
Yeast-raised no-knead flatbreads 


500g P flour
7g yeast
360ml water
1tbsp oilve oil
1tbsp sugar
1tsp salt

12 flatbreads


Method

Bloom yeast with olive oil.
Add wet to dry and mix with spoon.
Prove 30-60mins.
Make balls then roll into flatbreads.
Cook on skillet for 30 seconds (bubbles form on top).
Flip and cook for another 30 seconds.

Notes

Soft, tasty, good for gyros/falafels.
Kept at room temperature for a few days and reheated well. Have not tried freezing.

title: Cakes
text:
Apple crumble cake
Method

title: Cakes
text:
300g apples
100ml oil
175g light brown sugar
0.5tbsp apple cider vinegar
1/2 tbsp vanilla
240ml milk
250g plain flour
2 tsp cinnamon
0.5tsp ground cardamom
0.75 tsp BofS
1.5 tsp BP
Topping:
56g plain flour
31g sugar
44g butter

160°
45-50mins
8” round




Make crumble topping and set aside.
Cut apples into small pieces, about 0.75cm.
Combine oil, vinegar and vanilla.
Gradually mix in sugar.
Add in milk and combine.
Sift dry over wet in 2-3 batches.
Stir in apples, top with crumble and bake.

title: Cakes
text:
Banana loaf  


3-4 (~11.5oz) bananas
3.5oz light brown sugar
10.5oz SR flour
3.5oz sultanas
1.75oz walnuts
1tsp mixed spice
1tsp BP
5floz oil

160°
55-60mins
Loaf


Notes

Used to make at B&B.

title: Cakes
text:
Carrot cake   


6oz marg
6oz light brown sugar
3 eggs
4oz carrot
2oz raisins
2oz dates
1/2tsp cinnamon
1/4tsp nutmeg
1oz coconut
1oz walnuts
6oz wholemeal flour
pinch salt
1tsp BP

180°
90mins
8” round


Notes

For vegan option, replace eggs with 7.5oz apple puree and 1/2tsp BP, but may need to cover with foil during bake.

title: Cakes
text:
Chocolate and caramel cake


47.5g cocoa
120g light brown sugar
1tsp vanilla
87.5ml just boiled water
210g P flour
1/2 tsp BP
1/2 tsp B of S
125g butter
140 sugar
2 eggs
Filling:
150g sugar
150ml double cream
1/2 tsp vanilla
1tsp sea salt
Topping:
110g egg white (<3 eggs)
160g sugar
235g butter

160°
20-25mins
2 x 8” round


Method

Whisk cocoa, sugar, vanilla and water until smooth and leave cool 5 mins.
Cream butter and sugar, 3-5 mins, then beat in eggs 1 at a time.
Fold in dry 1/3 at a time, then cooled cocoa mixture.
Bake.
For caramel, sugar and 6tbsp water in saucepan over medium heat, cook 6-8 mins no stirring, until starts to turn deep amber.
Remove from heat and place in bowl cold water.
Slowly whisk in cream and vanilla -> thick pouring consistency (can stir over heat if necessary).
Stir in salt and leave to cool.
For buttercream, whisk egg whites and sugar until smooth.
Place over pan of simmering water for 5mins, whisking occasionally until sugar dissolves - feels smooth, not grainy between fingertips.
Whisk about 7mins to stiff peaks.
Add butter and whisk about 5mins, until smooth and glossy - don’t panic if appears to curdle, just keep whisking.
Add vanilla and 5 tbsp cooled caramel, 1tbsp at a time and mix until smooth.

Notes

Not too chocolately or too sweet.
Buttercream very smooth and silky. Could do with less buttercream.
Caramel sauce did not work as stated - hard lumps of sugar and had to heat slowly to get mix with cream - next time would not dunk in cold water, but would add warm cream instead.

title: Cakes
text:
Chocolate and sweet potato loaf


250 boiled sweet potato
100g plain chocolate
125 marg
150g light brown sugar
2 eggs
175g SR flour
1/2 tsp BP
75g chocolate chips
Topping:
100g plain chocolate
25g marg
2tbsp syrup
25g chocolate chips

160°
50-60mins
Loaf


Method

Mash potato and chocolate together first.

title: Cakes
text:
Chocolate cake 


400g caster sugar
100g cocoa
300g P flour
2tsp B of S
1tsp salt
500ml boiling water
125ml oil
1tbsp apple cider vinegar

180°
20-25mins
2 x 8” round


Method

Mix dry together.
Quickly add wet.

Notes

1.25 mix makes large 9” cake.

title: Cakes
text:
Devil’s food cake


2oz cocoa
6floz boiling water
6oz marg
12oz dark brown sugar
3 eggs
10oz P flour
3/2tsp B of S
1/4 tsp BP
4floz soured cream/buttermilk

180°
30-35mins
9” round


Method

Mix and cool cocoa and water.
Cream marg, sugar and eggs.
Sift dry twice.
Add dry to creamed in 3 batches, alternating with dairy.

Notes

Comes out a tall 2x8”, think would be better to have 3x8”.
150g cream/choc was enough ganache to fill and top 2x8”, but not sides.

title: Cakes
text:
Ginger cake 


8oz SR flour
1/2tsp B of S
2tsp ginger
1/2tsp cinnamon
1/4 pt milk
4oz marg
4tbsp treacle
4oz dark brown sugar
2 eggs

180°
45mins
8” round


Method

Melt milk, marg, treacle, sugar.

title: Cakes
text:
Ginger cake  


350g P flour
225g dark brown sugar
2-3tsp ginger
1tsp BP
1/2tsp B of S
pinch salt
1/2tsp cinammon
1/2tsp allspice
100ml oil
225ml water
4tbsp (~60g) treacle

180°
35-40mins
8” square


Notes

Freezes ok.

title: Cakes
text:
Kladdkaka 


150ml aquafaba
180g sugar
150g P flour
40g cocoa
2tsp BP
1/4tsp salt
100ml oil
icing sugar

200°
15-20mins
8” round


Method

Whisk aquafaba and sugar to white and fluffy (~5min, speed 4).
Combine dry ingredients, then gently fold in aquafaba mix.
Add oil and stir to smooth.
Bake until edges are firm and dry to touch, middle will be wet.
Cool in tin, dust.

Notes

Recipe said 13-15mins, but gave it 20. Could maybe have had a couple longer whilst still being fudgy in middle, but unsure, maybe oven not right temperature.

title: Cakes
text:
Lemon cake 


295ml milk
10ml apple cider vinegar
120ml aquafaba
115g butter
20ml oil
300g sugar
1 tbsp lemon zest
1 tbsp lemon extract
1dsp vanilla
350g P flour
12g baking powder
3g salt
turmeric

175°
?mins
2 x 8” round


Method

Combine milk and vinegar and sit aside for buttermilk.
Mix aquafaba 1-2 mins high speed into light and foamy and set aside.
Beat butter, oil, sugar and lemon zest 3 mins until light and fluffy.
Mix in buttermilk and aquafaba.
Fold in rest, do not overmix.

Notes

Paired with buttercream with lemon zest.

title: Cakes
text:
Loaves 


5oz marg
5oz caster
2eggs
7oz SR flour
3tbs milk

180°
60mins
Loaf


Notes

For Cherry & Almond add 4oz cherries and 2oz ground almond.
For Lemon Drizzle add zest 2 lemons and use 4tbsp (juice and caster sugar) to drizzle.

title: Cakes
text:
Marbled chocolate and orange  


8oz mix
1tsp BP
zest 1-2 oranges
4tsp orange juice
2tbsp cocoa
4oz plain choc (melted)

180°
75mins
8” round

title: Cakes
text:
Raspberry and almond cake


4oz SR flour
2oz ground almonds
5oz caster sugar
2eggs
4floz (5oz) yoghurt
4floz oil
1tsp vanilla/almond
5oz raspberries
flaked almonds, for topping

170°
50-60mins
8” round


Method

Whisk eggs, yoghurt, oil, essence.

title: Cakes
text:
Raspberry and white chocolate cake


8oz mix
100g white chocolate
175 raspberries
Filling:
200g white chocolate
250ml double cream

160°
20-25mins
2 x 8” round


Method

Melt butter and chocolate together, cool 2mins.
Beat in eggs and sugar.
Fold in flour and raspberries.

Notes

Sweet.
Raspberries sunk, but maybe because cooked as one big cake.
Used oat cream for ganache, which was more like pouring cream, but still worked.

title: Cakes
text:
Victoria cake  


8oz mix
1tsp BP

180°
25-30mins
2 x 8” round


Notes

Or makes 20 fairy cakes or 16 cupcakes.
Buttercream

title: Desserts and Confectionery
text:
Bakewell tart
Method

title: Desserts and Confectionery
text:
Pastry:
250g P flour
40g icing sugar
1/4tsp salt
150g butter
Filling:
80g melted butter
130g sugar
60g P flour
10g cornflour
90ml aquafaba
200g ground almonds
1tsp BP
1/2tsp almond extract
6tbsp raspberry jam
Topping:
150g raspberries
flaked almonds

180°
23-25cm tart




Shape pastry into disc and chill half an hour.
Roll and line tart.
Prick and freeze 20mins.
Bake with beans 20mins, then without 10mins until pale golden then set aside.
Whisk melted butter and sugar, then whisk in flours.
Gradually whisk in aquafaba, then rest of frangipane.
Assemble and bake 30-45mins.

title: Desserts and Confectionery
text:
Chocolate caramels  


100g dark brown sugar
2tbsp water
2tbsp tahini or nut butter
2tbsp coconut oil or vegan butter
1/4 tsp fine sea salt
1/2 tsp vanilla
300g dark chocolate

35 ice cubes


Method

Heat sugar and water until dissolved and starting to bubble - swirl if necessary - 2-3 mins max.
Remove from heat and add oil, tahini, salt and vanilla and stir.
Heat very low for 30 seconds if won’t come together.
Cool - will be very runny at first, but will thicken as cools.
Once cool, line moulds with 3mm chocolate and leave couple of mins.
Then fill with cool caramel and top with 2-3mm chocolate.
After 30 mins in freezer, can demould.

Notes

Thought the tahini was quite strong, but were liked by others. Maybe peanut butter would be nice?

title: Desserts and Confectionery
text:
Chocolate fudge 


350g dark chocolate
370g vegan condensed milk
chopped nuts to decorate

20cm square


Method

Melt over low heat, stirring occasionally until smooth and silky.
Press into tin and chill for 1 hour or until set.

Notes

Was ok, would be ok use of leftover condensed milk.
One third of recipe in large glass clip tub was under 2cm thick.

title: Desserts and Confectionery
text:
Chocolate pudding 


65g sugar
2tbsp cocoa
1.5tbsp cornstarch
295ml milk
15g butter
0.5tsp vanilla

3 dessert pots


Method

Whisk sugar, cocoa and cornstarch until no lumps in a pan.
Add milk and combine.
Heat to simmer and whisk often.
Simmer about 3 mins until slightly thickened and glossy.
Remove from heat and whisk in butter and vanilla.
Pour into dishes and chill overnight.

Notes

Will thicken as it cools.
Unsure about this recipe - was ok, but texture a bit odd.

title: Desserts and Confectionery
text:
Chocolate tart 


Base:
350g digestives
2tbsp cocoa
1tbsp P flour
1tbsp syrup
125g-175g butter
Filling:
2 x 400g cans coconut milk, chilled
200g dark chocolate
1tbsp syrup

180°
10-12mins
23cm tart


Method

Crush biscuits, mix in rest and enough butter to create dough.
Press into tin, bake and cool.
Whisk melted chocolate, syrup and only thick coconut (discard water).
Pour over base and set in fridge for 3-4 hours.

Notes

Kept in fridge for few days.
Nice with raspberries.

title: Desserts and Confectionery
text:
Chocolate truffles 


300g dark chocolate
240ml coconut cream
dessicated coconut

28 truffles


Notes

Very soft - maybe coat in chocolate, or add nut in centre?

title: Desserts and Confectionery
text:
Crumble topping   


4oz P flour
4oz marg
2oz oats
3oz sugar
2oz coconut

180°
35-40mins
large red dish


Notes

Good for using up frozen fruits.
For large red dish want about 600g fruits.
Third-half mix for small glass square.

title: Desserts and Confectionery
text:
Easy chocolate pudding


50g P flour
1/2tsp BP
1tbs cocoa
50g caster sugar
50g melted butter
1 egg
vanilla
1- tbs milk
25g nuts
Topping:
50g brown sugar
1tbs cocoa
60ml hot water

180°
30mins
1/2 litre dish


Method

Pour topping on top before baking (becomes a sauce underneath sponge).

Notes

Serves 3.

title: Desserts and Confectionery
text:
Rolos


150g chocolate
100g granulated sugar
65ml double cream
40g butter

12 ice cube size


Method

Melt 2/3 chocolate over pan of hot water.
Line molds with chocolate and chill.
Cook sugar with minimal stirring over low-med flame until fluid and amber.
Add butter and combine.
Pour in cream, stir for a minute or two, remove from heat to cool (can add pinch salt if desired).
Once caramel is cooled assemble and chill.

Notes

Called them ‘Blockos’ because they were big - used ice tray, because don’t have a mold.

title: Desserts and Confectionery
text:
Steamed syrup cake


1tbsp breadcrumbs
3tbsp syrup
6oz mix

90mins
1 litre bowl


Method

Put breadcrumbs and syrup at bottom of dish.

Notes

Optional lemon zest.

title: Desserts and Confectionery
text:
Sticky toffee pudding 


120ml water
200g dates
110g butter
110g light brown sugar
200g SR flour
1tsp B of S
1tbsp ginger
2tsp mixed spice
1tsp cinnamon
240ml milk
1tbsp apple cider vinegar
Sauce:
3tbsp syrup
200g light brown sugar
150g butter
1tsp vanilla

170°
50mins
1 litre dish


Method

Simmer dates in water for 5mins.
Cream butter and sugar.
Add vinegar very very last.
Melt sauce ingredients and simmer 5m.
Prick, pour over 1/2 sauce. Rest to serve.

title: Desserts and Confectionery
text:

cream
berries

8-10mins

title: Dinners
text:
Bean burgers
Method

title: Dinners
text:
400g black beans
300g sweet potato, mashed
black pepper
cumin
paprika
fresh coriander

8 burgers




Mash everything together, shape and freeze.

title: Dinners
text:
Falafel  


16oz dried chickpeas
1/2tsp BofS
1 small onion
1/4 cup parsley
3-5 cloves garlic
3/2 tbs gram flour
1.75 tsp salt
2tsp cumin
1tsp ground coriander
1/4tsp black pepper
1/4tsp cayenne pepper
pinch cardamom
1tsp BP
oil for frying

182-190°



Method

Soak chickpeas in water and BofS 12-24 hours.
Drain and rinse well.
Food process everything until rough, coarse meal forms - between couscous and paste.
Refrigerate 1-2 hours.
Shape into balls - will stick together loosely at first, but will bind once begin to fry.
If won’t bind, try processor again to make more paste-like.
If stil not, try adding flour.
Fry 2-3 mins per side.

Notes

9.5oz chickpeas made enough for 5 people.
Can freeze cooked falafel and reheat in oven from frozen, but not as good as fresh.

title: Dinners
text:
Toad-in-hole


70g P flour
1 egg
87.5ml milk
seasoning

200°
25-30mins
Small glass square


Method

Cook 3 sausages in oil in oven.
Make batter and leave to stand until sausages ready.
Pour batter into hot dish and cook until risen and golden.

Notes

Can use oat milk.

Notes

title: Extras
text:

1-2 icing sugar






Add icing sugar and little milk to make stiffer or more spreadable.



Can add vanilla, peppermint, lemon zest …
Can replace small amount of icing sugar with cocoa.
For 8” Victoria cake: 60g butter, 120g icing sugar.

120ml milk

turmeric




Method

Whisk over medium heat until thickens, about 5-10 mins.

Notes

Will thicken a bit as it cools.
Half of this is enough for lemon sandwich biscuits.

title: Pancakes and Scones
text:
225g SR flour
1tsp mustard powder
1/4tsp salt
pinch cayenne
1tsp BP
55g butter
100g grated cheese
1 egg
120ml milk

190°
10mins
10 x 7.5cm




Mix dry, then rub in butter to breadcrumbs.
Stir in cheese.
Beat egg in jug and add milk.
Add most wet to dry, but keep a little for glazing.
Roll to 1.5cm thick.

title: Pancakes and Scones
text:
Classic scones  


350g SR flour
1tsp BP
85g butter
3tbsp caster sugar
optional 85g fruit
175ml milk
1tsp vanilla
squeeze lemon juice

200°
10mins
6 x 7.8cm or 14 x 5.8cm


Method

Mix dry.
Rub in butter to breadcrumbs.
Stir in sugar (and fruit).
Warm milk about 30seconds then add vanilla and lemon and set aside for a moment.
Heat baking tray.
Add wet to dry well and combine quickly with knife.
Tip onto floured surface, dredge with flour and fold over 2-3 times.
Pat into about 4cm high, cut, glaze, bake.

Fold in mixed dry.
Cool in tin, then in fridge for few hours before cutting.

Very rich and dark, so cut very small (40).

Melt butter, sugar, milk gently until dissolves.
Boil briskly 3 mins.
Stir in icing sugar, beat and spread quickly.

180°
20-25mins
8” square


Notes

Can replace 2oz sugar with 2oz coconut, may need extra squirt of syrup.
Made without fruit and nuts, added 1oz more of oats and ginger and came out ok. May need less sugar?
Be careful not to overcook, 20mins probably better.
Can cut into 36.

title: Traybakes
text:
Jam crumble bars  


180g oats

175°

title: Traybakes
text:
Lemon bars 


Base:
6oz P flour
4oz marg
2oz caster sugar
Filling:
200g caster sugar
25g P flour
pinch salt
3 eggs
3 lemon zest
200ml lemon juice (3-4 lemons)

180°
15-20mins

160°
10-15mins
8” square


Method

Bake shortbread at 180 for 15-20mins.
Whisk filling together while base is cooling, pour over and bake at 160 for 10-15 mins (until top is just set).
Dust with icing sugar.

title: Traybakes
text:
Lemon bars 


Base: use shortbread base from other recipe.
Filling:   177ml lemon juice (about 4 large lemons)
Optional 2tsp lemon zest
300g caster sugar
296 coconut milk - mostly the thick part
6tbs cornflour
pinch turmeric

180°
15mins
8” square


Method

Bake base.
Whisk filling ingredients well and heat over medium heat until sugar dissolves and mixture thickens.
Spread over base and bake.
Chill 1-2 hours or overnight until set.

Notes

Nice, very lemony/tart, even without zest.

title: Traybakes
text:
Peppermint mini rolls 


150ml aquafaba
100g caster sugar
80g P flour
2tbsp cocoa
1/2tsp BP
1/4 tsp vanilla
Filling:
125g butter
125g icing sugar
1tsp milk
few drops peppermint extract

24 x 32 cm


Method

Whip aquafaba to almost stiff peaks.
Add sugar in spoonful at a time, whilst whipping to stiff.
Add whites to dry ingredients in 2 alternating lots.
Spread in tin and bake 5 mins at 220, then 5-10mins at 180.
Cool 2mins, roll, then leave to cool.
Spread filling, roll and chill 30mins.
Coat in 180g chocolate and chill to set.

Notes

Very tasty.
Aquafaba whipping can take 15mins+.
Original recipe uses 3 eggs instead. -
Reddit tips for swiss roll.

title: Traybakes
text:
Raspberry and white chocolate blondies


140g (5-oz) white chocolate
75g (2.6oz) marg
100g (3.5oz) caster sugar
2 eggs
vanilla
pinch salt
125g (4.5-oz) P flour
1box raspberries

180°
17-20mins
8” square


Method

Brownie method.

title: Traybakes
text:
Twix 


Base:
300g P flour
10g caster sugar
200g butter
1tsp vanilla
Filling:
640g vegan condensed milk
270g butter
100g light brown sugar
250g chocolate to top

180°
30mins
8” square


Method

Bake shortbread until lightly golden then leave to cool.
Place all filling ingredients over low-medium heat until turn amber, stirring all the time - takes 15-20mins to reach firm ball stage.
Pour over base and chill 3-4hrs until set.

Notes

Softer and chewier than caramel shortbread - more like Twix.
